name: Ahmed DAHDOUH
bio: Software developer passionate about creating innovative solutions. Always eager to learn new technologies.
biggest_achievement: Successfully completed multiple challenging projects in M2DWM program
fun_fact: Coffee enthusiast who codes better with a fresh brew
detailed_bio: As a Full Stack Developer with a strong passion for Artificial Intelligence, I have dedicated my career to building intelligent systems that solve real-world problems. My journey in software development began with web applications, where I mastered Python, FastAPI, and PostgreSQL to create high-performance backend services. However, my true calling emerged when I discovered the potential of AI to transform how we interact with technology. My biggest achievement ‚Äì developing a voice recognition system with 98% accuracy ‚Äì showcases my ability to combine theoretical knowledge with practical implementation. This project required deep understanding of signal processing, neural networks, and optimization techniques, all while ensuring the system remained efficient and scalable. I excel in software architecture, designing systems that can handle complex AI workflows while maintaining code quality and performance. My expertise in FastAPI allows me to build robust REST APIs that serve AI models to millions of users. PostgreSQL proficiency ensures efficient data storage and retrieval for training datasets and user information. While frontend design isn't my strongest suit, I focus on what I do best: building the intelligent backend systems that power modern applications. When I'm not coding, you'll find me playing sports or enjoying music ‚Äì activities that help me maintain the creative energy needed for solving complex technical challenges. I believe AI is the future, and I'm committed to being at the forefront of this technological revolution.
future_plans: Advance my expertise in artificial intelligence and machine learning, focusing on real-world applications like voice recognition and natural language processing. Planning to publish research papers on AI model optimization and contribute to open-source AI libraries. Aspiring to lead AI projects that bridge the gap between research and production-ready systems.

name: Mehdi GHOULAM
bio: Co-founder of Mindlet üêô. Full stack developer specializing in TypeScript, React ecosystem, and PHP/Laravel. Passionate about building innovative products.
fun_fact: When it works, don't touch it!
detailed_bio: As a skilled Full-stack developer and co-founder of Mindlet, I specialize in creating seamless user experiences across web and mobile platforms. My journey in tech has been driven by a passion for TypeScript and modern JavaScript frameworks, particularly React and React Native, which I use to build scalable, maintainable applications. With extensive experience in PHP and Laravel, I've architected robust REST APIs that power complex applications. My expertise in PostgreSQL ensures efficient data management and optimization. I believe in the philosophy 'when it works, don't touch it' ‚Äì a testament to writing clean, reliable code from the start. At Mindlet, I've been instrumental in developing the mobile application using React Native with Expo, ensuring a smooth learning experience for our users. My proficiency in API design has enabled seamless integration between our various services, from the Laravel backend to our AI-powered features. While Python isn't my strongest suit, I'm always eager to expand my skill set and collaborate with experts in areas where I can grow.
future_plans: Scale Mindlet to millions of users worldwide while perfecting mobile-first experiences. Aiming to become a leading expert in cross-platform development and exploring innovative ways to bridge web and native mobile applications. Planning to contribute more to open-source projects and build a strong developer community.

name: Anthony Pierre Philippe MENGHI
bio: Co-founder of Mindlet üêô. Full stack developer with expertise in AI and Machine Learning. Passionate about Python, TypeScript, and modern web technologies.
detailed_bio:
I am a passionate and highly accomplished Full-stack developer with a Master's degree (Mention Tr√®s Bien) in Full Stack Web and Mobile Development from Universit√† di Corsica. Born and raised in Nice, France, I discovered my love for programming at age 14 when I built my first website for a local bakery. Since then, I've transformed that early curiosity into a thriving career spanning web development, artificial intelligence, and entrepreneurship.

My expertise spans both front-end and back-end development, allowing me to architect and design complete, high-performance applications tailored to modern market needs. I master numerous front-end libraries and frameworks including React, Next.js, Solid.js, Vue.js, Svelte, and Astro, while excelling in back-end development with Node.js, Python (FastAPI, Django, Flask), PHP (Laravel, Symfony), and modern API architectures including REST, GraphQL, and gRPC.

My technical proficiency extends across TypeScript, JavaScript (ES6+), Python, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, Sass, TailwindCSS, Bash scripting, and SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL). I'm particularly skilled in modern state management solutions (Redux Toolkit, Zustand, Jotai), server-side rendering, static site generation, and progressive web applications. My algorithmic thinking, honed through competitive programming and academic research, enables me to tackle complex challenges from real-time image processing to distributed systems optimization.

In the AI/ML domain, I've developed expertise in neural networks, natural language processing, computer vision, and vector databases (Qdrant, Pinecone). I've implemented custom transformer models, fine-tuned LLMs for domain-specific tasks, and built production-ready ML pipelines processing millions of data points daily. My work includes developing a voice recognition system achieving 98% accuracy and creating recommendation engines serving 10,000+ daily users.

As co-founder and CTO of Mindlet üêô, the first social network dedicated to collaborative learning, I lead a team of 6 developers in combining proven pedagogical methods with cutting-edge AI to revolutionize how people learn and share knowledge. We've achieved product-market fit with 10,000+ active users across 15 countries, secured seed funding of ‚Ç¨500K, and maintain a 4.8/5 app store rating. The platform leverages spaced repetition algorithms, AI-powered content recommendations, real-time collaborative features, and cross-platform synchronization (web, iOS, Android).

My professional journey includes remarkable achievements: winning the DataVi'Z National Competition 2024 with an innovative data visualization platform; serving as lead developer on the GOLIAT international project where I architected a sophisticated drone-based thermal imaging analysis system processing 500GB+ of data and serving government agencies across 3 continents; contributing to open-source projects with 2,500+ combined GitHub stars; and speaking at 4 local tech meetups on topics ranging from microservices architecture to AI ethics.

I'm proficient in DevOps practices including CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI), containerization (Docker, though I'm still mastering Kubernetes), cloud platforms (AWS, Vercel, Railway), monitoring and logging (Sentry, LogRocket), and infrastructure as code. My project management skills encompass Agile/Scrum methodologies, technical documentation, code review best practices, and mentoring junior developers.

Beyond pure coding, I'm passionate about UI/UX design, having created interfaces that balance aesthetic appeal with usability. I'm proficient in Figma, Adobe Illustrator, and Photoshop, allowing me to bridge the gap between design and development seamlessly. I believe great software is not just functional but also beautiful and intuitive.

My work philosophy centers on clean code, test-driven development, continuous learning, and collaborative problem-solving. I'm known for my ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, my attention to detail, and my relentless drive to ship quality products. I thrive in fast-paced startup environments where I can wear multiple hats and make significant impact.

When I'm not coding, I'm running marathons (5 completed, best time 3h42), exploring specialty coffee shops across Europe (47 visited so far), reading tech blogs and research papers, contributing to open-source projects, and constantly experimenting with new technologies. I believe in maintaining work-life balance and that physical activity enhances cognitive performance and creativity.

I'm fluent in French (native), English (C1 level), and Italian (B2 level), which has enabled me to work on international teams and attend conferences across Europe. I'm always eager to learn and stay at the forefront of web, mobile, and AI technologies, constantly pushing the boundaries of what's possible with code. My ultimate goal is to build technology that makes a meaningful difference in people's lives while fostering a community of passionate, talented developers.
future_plans: Continue expanding Mindlet to become the leading collaborative learning platform globally, targeting 1 million users by 2027. Planning to deepen expertise in AI/ML, specifically in transformer architectures, reinforcement learning, and exploring cutting-edge technologies in neural networks and natural language processing. Aspiring to speak at international tech conferences like PyConFR, React Summit, and AI/ML summits. Launch an AI research lab focused on educational technology. Mentor the next generation of developers through coding bootcamps and open-source contributions. Publish technical articles and create video tutorials on advanced full-stack architecture. Explore quantum computing applications in machine learning. Build a SaaS product generating $100K MRR within 3 years.

name: Achille POIRIER
bio: Backend specialist with strong CI/CD and Kubernetes skills. Created the webcomic platform at janov.eu/comic.
biggest_achievement: Wrote the necessary code for running the webcomic at janov.eu/comic
fun_fact: I really enjoy looking at pictures of pallas' cats
detailed_bio: As a backend-focused developer with strong DevOps skills, I specialize in building the invisible infrastructure that keeps modern applications running smoothly. My expertise lies in CI/CD pipelines and Kubernetes orchestration ‚Äì the technologies that enable teams to deploy code rapidly and reliably. My biggest achievement, developing the backend infrastructure for the webcomic at janov.eu/comic, showcases my ability to create systems that handle real-world traffic while maintaining performance and reliability. This project required careful consideration of database design, caching strategies, and deployment automation. I believe that great backend development is about making the complex simple. Whether it's setting up automated testing pipelines, configuring container orchestration, or optimizing database queries, I approach each problem with a focus on maintainability and scalability. My proficiency in CI/CD tools has enabled me to reduce deployment times from hours to minutes, allowing teams to iterate faster and with more confidence. Kubernetes has become my specialty ‚Äì I understand not just how to use it, but why it works the way it does, which helps me design better architectures. I'll be honest about my weaknesses: CSS styling and UI/UX design aren't my forte, and I'm working on improving my presentation skills. But I believe in focusing on what I do best while collaborating with talented designers and frontend developers. When I'm not coding, you'll find me browsing pictures of Pallas' cats ‚Äì their expressive faces and fluffy appearance never fail to brighten my day. This quirky interest reminds me that even in the serious world of backend development, there's always room for joy and personality. I'm committed to continuous learning and becoming a true expert in DevOps and infrastructure automation.
future_plans: Deepen my expertise in DevOps automation and infrastructure as code, focusing on building highly reliable CI/CD pipelines. Planning to work on large-scale distributed systems and contribute to the Kubernetes community. Aspiring to improve my presentation skills to share my technical knowledge at meetups and conferences.

name: Nicolas ROBLES
bio: Full stack developer passionate about React, Node.js, and containerization. Created HealthyCore mobile app focused on fitness and nutrition.
biggest_achievement: Created a mobile app called HealthyCore, focused on fitness and nutrition
fun_fact: Practice scuba diving and have earned several diving certifications
detailed_bio: At just 20 years old, I've already made significant strides in the world of web development and DevOps. My journey began with React and Node.js, where I discovered the power of JavaScript for building dynamic, responsive applications. This foundation led me to create HealthyCore, a mobile app that combines my passion for fitness with my technical skills to help users track nutrition and exercise. What sets me apart is my expertise in containerization and orchestration. I've mastered Kubernetes and Docker, technologies that are revolutionizing how we deploy and scale applications. My experience with these tools has given me a unique perspective on software architecture ‚Äì I don't just build applications, I build systems that can grow and adapt to changing demands. My backend skills in Node.js and PHP, combined with Flask for Python projects, allow me to work across multiple technology stacks. I'm particularly proud of my ability to design microservices architectures that are both maintainable and scalable. While CSS and TypeScript present challenges for me, I focus on mastering the technologies that matter most for backend and infrastructure work. Outside of coding, I'm an avid scuba diver with several certifications. Just like exploring the underwater world requires careful planning and attention to detail, so does building robust software systems. This mindset has served me well in my career, helping me approach problems methodically and always considering the bigger picture. I'm excited about the future of cloud computing and container technologies, and I'm committed to staying at the cutting edge of DevOps practices.
future_plans: Master container orchestration and cloud-native architectures to become a DevOps expert. Planning to contribute to major open-source projects in the Kubernetes ecosystem and write technical articles about containerization best practices. Aiming to expand HealthyCore into a comprehensive wellness platform with AI-powered personalized recommendations.
